title: Epic 1 — User Management & Authentication
body: Implement user registration, login, roles, and account linking for parents and players.

title: US-1.1: Parent Registration
body: As a parent, I can register for a new account using email/password.

title: US-1.2: Parent Login
body: As a parent, I can log into my account securely.

title: US-1.3: Link Player to Parent
body: As a parent, I can register my child as a player and link them to my account.

title: US-1.4: Player Profile Access
body: As a player, I can view my personal profile once registered.

title: US-1.5: Parent Profile Edit
body: As a parent, I can edit my profile and update my contact information.

title: US-1.6: Role-Based Access Control
body: As a system, I enforce role-based access: parent, player, coach, admin.

title: Epic 2 — Player Profile Management
body: Enable creation, update and storage of player profiles.

title: US-2.1: Create Player Profile
body: As a parent, I can create a player profile with name, photo, team, and position.

title: US-2.2: Update Player Profile
body: As a parent, I can update my child’s profile and re-upload new photos.

title: US-2.3: Secure Photo Storage
body: As a system, I store and validate uploaded photos securely.

title: US-2.4: Coach Access to Players
body: As a coach, I can view the profiles of players on my team.

title: Epic 3 — NFT Minting Flow
body: Enable parents to request NFT minting and admins to approve mint requests.

title: US-3.1: Mint Request Submission
body: As a parent, I can submit a mint request for my child’s player card.

title: US-3.2: Store Mint Requests
body: As a system, I store mint requests in a pending state.

title: US-3.3: Admin Approve/Reject Minting
body: As an admin, I can approve or reject minting requests.

title: US-3.4: Generate NFT Record
body: As a system, I generate an NFT record upon approval (mocked for MVP).

title: US-3.5: Notify Parent of Mint Status
body: As a system, I notify parents when minting is approved or rejected.

title: Epic 4 — Marketplace Core Functionality
body: Enable listing, browsing, and purchasing of NFTs in marketplace.

title: US-4.1: List NFT for Sale
body: As a parent/player, I can list my NFT for sale in the marketplace.

title: US-4.2: Browse Marketplace
body: As a buyer, I can view all NFTs listed for sale.

title: US-4.3: Purchase NFT
body: As a buyer, I can purchase an NFT and transfer ownership (internal DB transfer for MVP).

title: US-4.4: Record Transaction
body: As a system, I track transactions and update ownership records.

title: US-4.5: Cancel NFT Listing
body: As a seller, I can cancel my listing before it sells.

title: Epic 5 — Parental Controls & Approvals
body: Add parental approval layers for safety and compliance.

title: US-5.1: Parent Mint Approval
body: As a parent, I can approve or deny minting requests initiated for my child.

title: US-5.2: Approve/Deny Trading Access
body: As a parent, I can enable or disable trading permissions for my child.

title: US-5.3: Enforce Trading Block
body: As a system, I block all unapproved child transactions automatically.

title: US-5.4: Approval Dashboard
body: As a parent, I can view pending approval requests in a dashboard.

title: Epic 6 — Admin Dashboard
body: Create minimal admin panel for minting management.

title: US-6.1: View Mint Queue
body: As an admin, I can see a queue of pending mint requests.

title: US-6.2: Approve/Reject Mint Requests
body: As an admin, I can approve or reject requests.

title: US-6.3: View Moderation Logs
body: As an admin, I can view moderation logs for all actions taken.

title: Epic 7 — Transaction History & Logs
body: Enable users to see their transaction history.

title: US-7.1: View My Transaction History
body: As a parent, I can see my transaction history.

title: US-7.2: Store Transaction Logs
body: As a system, I store a transaction log for compliance and reporting.

title: Epic 8 — Testing, Demo Prep & Polishing
body: Complete final testing and prepare demo data for presentation.

title: US-8.1: Seed Demo Data
body: As a developer, I can seed the database with test data for demo.

title: US-8.2: Run Smoke Tests
body: As a QA, I can run a smoke test across all core flows.

title: US-8.3: Final Demo Prep
body: As a presenter, I can run the full demo scenario successfully.
